title: Drawing, "Projects for decoration on tops of arches", 1760–80
medium: Pen and ink, brush and grey water color, on paper
markings: Watermark: GN between two crossed branches
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: At left: left half of an escutcheon on top of an arch, a cherub peeks from behind a scrollwork frame, a garland emerges from behind him. At right: left half of a palmette of acanthus beside a scroll. Above the latter: sketch for part of the escutcheon at left, sketch of acanthus leaves. Below: an unfinished design similar to the on above it. Pen scribbles above at left.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Projects for decoration on tops of arches", 1760–80.
1760–80. Pen and ink, brush and grey water color, on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1770.
